attendance  event       income      member

content.content:
CREATE TABLE event
(
    event_id   TEXT
        constraint event_pk
            primary key,
    event_name TEXT,
    event_date TEXT,
    type       TEXT,
    notes      TEXT,
    location   TEXT,
    status     TEXT
);
CREATE TABLE major
(
    major_id   TEXT
        constraint major_pk
            primary key,
    major_name TEXT,
    department TEXT,
    college    TEXT
);
CREATE TABLE zip_code
(
    zip_code    INTEGER
        constraint zip_code_pk
            primary key,
    type        TEXT,
    city        TEXT,
    county      TEXT,
    state       TEXT,
    short_state TEXT
);
CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS "attendance"
(
    link_to_event  TEXT,
    link_to_member TEXT,
    primary key (link_to_event, link_to_member),
    foreign key (link_to_event) references event(event_id),
    foreign key (link_to_member) references member(member_id)
);
CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS "budget"
(
    budget_id     TEXT
            primary key,
    category      TEXT,
    spent         REAL,
    remaining     REAL,
    amount        INTEGER,
    event_status  TEXT,
    link_to_event TEXT,
    foreign key (link_to_event) references event(event_id)
);
CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS "expense"
(
    expense_id          TEXT
            primary key,
    expense_description TEXT,
    expense_date        TEXT,
    cost                REAL,
    approved            TEXT,
    link_to_member      TEXT,
    link_to_budget      TEXT,
    foreign key (link_to_budget) references budget(budget_id),
    foreign key (link_to_member) references member(member_id)
);
CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS "income"
(
    income_id      TEXT
        constraint income_pk
            primary key,
    date_received  TEXT,
    amount         INTEGER,
    source         TEXT,
    notes          TEXT,
    link_to_member TEXT,
    foreign key (link_to_member) references member(member_id)
);
CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS "member"
(
    member_id     TEXT
        constraint member_pk
            primary key,
    first_name    TEXT,
    last_name     TEXT,
    email         TEXT,
    position      TEXT,
    t_shirt_size  TEXT,
    phone         TEXT,
    zip           INTEGER,
    link_to_major TEXT,
    foreign key (link_to_major) references major(major_id),
    foreign key (zip) references zip_code(zip_code)
);

content.text: Now I understand the schema. The claim is about members who have expenses across multiple events, and that `rec4BLdZHS2Blfp4v` had the highest cost. I need to join `expense` with `budget` to get event info, then find members with expenses in more than one event, and check who had the highest cost.

input.command:
sqlite3 "/Users/david/workspace/claimdb/test_dbs/student_club.sqlite" "
SELECT e.link_to_member, MAX(e.cost) as max_cost
FROM expense e
JOIN budget b ON e.link_to_budget = b.budget_id
WHERE e.link_to_member IN (
    SELECT e2.link_to_member
    FROM expense e2
    JOIN budget b2 ON e2.link_to_budget = b2.budget_id
    GROUP BY e2.link_to_member
    HAVING COUNT(DISTINCT b2.link_to_event) > 1
)
GROUP BY e.link_to_member
ORDER BY max_cost DESC
LIMIT 10;
"
input.description: Find members with expenses across multiple events and their highest cost

content.text:
The query shows that among members with expenses across multiple events, `recro8T1MPMwRadVH` had the highest cost of $295.12, not `rec4BLdZHS2Blfp4v` whose highest cost was $195.30.

But let me re-read the hint: "MAX(cost where COUNT(event_id) > 1)". This might mean: find the single highest cost value among all expenses from members who have expenses in more than one event.

input.command:
sqlite3 "/Users/david/workspace/claimdb/test_dbs/student_club.sqlite" "
SELECT e.link_to_member, e.cost
FROM expense e
JOIN budget b ON e.link_to_budget = b.budget_id
WHERE e.link_to_member IN (
    SELECT e2.link_to_member
    FROM expense e2
    JOIN budget b2 ON e2.link_to_budget = b2.budget_id
    GROUP BY e2.link_to_member
    HAVING COUNT(DISTINCT b2.link_to_event) > 1
)
ORDER BY e.cost DESC
LIMIT 10;
"
input.description: List all expenses from multi-event members, ordered by cost
